description.para: Calls the AWS IoT Events Data BatchDisableAlarm API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2022 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Disables one or more alarms. The alarms change to the DISABLED state after you disable them.
The list of disable action requests. You can specify up to 10 requests per operation.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'ErrorEntries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchDisableAlarmResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchDisableAlarmResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The list of disable action requests. You can specify up to 10 requests per operation.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'ErrorEntries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchDisableAlarmResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchDisableAlarmResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet returns a collection of Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchAlarmActionErrorEntry objects. The service call response (type Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchDisableAlarmResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the AWS IoT Events Data BatchPutMessage API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2022 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Sends a set of messages to the IoT Events system. Each message payload is transformed into the input you specify ("inputName") and ingested into any detectors that monitor that input. If multiple messages are sent, the order in which the messages are processed isn't guaranteed. To guarantee ordering, you must send messages one at a time and wait for a successful response.
The list of messages to send. Each message has the following format: '{ "messageId": "string", "inputName": "string", "payload": "string"}'

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'BatchPutMessageErrorEntries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchPutMessageResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchPutMessageResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Message parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Message' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The list of messages to send. Each message has the following format: '{ "messageId": "string", "inputName": "string", "payload": "string"}'

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Message parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Message' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'BatchPutMessageErrorEntries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchPutMessageResponse). This cmdlet returns a collection of Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchPutMessageErrorEntry objects. The service call response (type Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchPutMessageResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2022 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: The name of the alarm model.

Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.DescribeAlarmResponse). Calls the AWS IoT Events Data BatchDeleteDetector API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2022 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para: Deletes one or more detectors that were created. When a detector is deleted, its state will be cleared and the detector will be removed from the list of detectors. The deleted detector will no longer appear if referenced in the ListDetectors API call.
The list of one or more detectors to be deleted.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'BatchDeleteDetectorErrorEntries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchDeleteDetectorResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchDeleteDetectorResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.
The list of one or more detectors to be deleted.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'BatchDeleteDetectorErrorEntries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchDeleteDetectorResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchDeleteDetectorResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet returns a collection of Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchDeleteDetectorErrorEntry objects. The service call response (type Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.BatchDeleteDetectorResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the AWS IoT Events Data ListDetectors API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2022 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para:
Lists detectors (the instances of a detector model).
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.
The name of the detector model whose detectors (instances) are listed.
A filter that limits results to those detectors (instances) in the given state.

The maximum number of results to be returned per request.
Note: In AWSPowerShell and AWSPowerShell.NetCore this parameter is used to limit the total number of items returned by the cmdlet.
In AWS.Tools this parameter is simply passed to the service to specify how many items should be returned by each service call.
Pipe the output of this cmdlet into Select-Object -First to terminate retrieving data pages early and control the number of items returned.

The token that you can use to return the next set of results.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'DetectorSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.ListDetectorsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.ListDetectorsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the DetectorModelName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^DetectorModelName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.
The name of the detector model whose detectors (instances) are listed.

The maximum number of results to be returned per request.
Note: In AWSPowerShell and AWSPowerShell.NetCore this parameter is used to limit the total number of items returned by the cmdlet.
In AWS.Tools this parameter is simply passed to the service to specify how many items should be returned by each service call.
Pipe the output of this cmdlet into Select-Object -First to terminate retrieving data pages early and control the number of items returned.

The token that you can use to return the next set of results.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the DetectorModelName parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^DetectorModelName' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'DetectorSummaries'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.ListDetectorsResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.ListDetectorsResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.
A filter that limits results to those detectors (instances) in the given state.

This cmdlet returns a collection of Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.DetectorSummary objects. The service call response (type Amazon.IoTEventsData.Model.ListDetectorsResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.

description.para: Returns information about the specified detector (instance).
